result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl M. Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full from cash bond posted

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl M. Cook

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:50 p.m. Defendant Earl M. Cook in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement to agreement - victim rights legislation complied - no response from victims. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing. Court imposes fine and costs totaling $1,000; cash bond to be applied. Adj. 3:02  p.m.
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:54 p.m. Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli files Authorization -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:54 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Earl M. Cook
Current: 166 US Hwy 51 North, Woodruff, WI 54568 United States  (Effective: 02-05-2016)
Prior: 7040 Bass Lake Road, Lake Tomahawk, WI 54539

1:23 p.m. Defendant Earl M. Cook in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to obtain attorney-will contact public defender's office. Defendant requests anger management classes - Court explains procedure - not a condition of bond. Bail continued. Adj. 1:25 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

No intoxicants; no taverns. No contact with Amanda Sweeney, including two minor children not common to parties. Electronic or telephone contact with Sweeney only for limited purpose of regarding mutual parental responsiblities for common child.

1:44 p.m. Defendant Earl M. Cook in court, in custody, via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond. Adj. 1:48 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
